{{Redirect|Flattening|the {{el|be}} equivalent|Bedrock Edition Flattening}}{{exclusive|java}}
In [[Java Edition 1.13]], the change known as "'''The Flattening'''" was performed, which modified the IDs of many blocks, items, [[biome]]s, [[Particles (Java Edition)|particles]], [[painting]]s, [[entities]], [[statistics]] and sound events, removed numeric IDs, added and removed some [[Java Edition data values|block states]], and changed [[NBT format|NBT tags]] and display names.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20180830011432/https://bugs.mojang.com/secure/attachment/151784/the_flattening.txt "the_flattening.txt"] ([https://bugs.mojang.com/secure/attachment/151784/the_flattening.txt original]), of {{bug|MC-121742}}</ref>

Later changes to IDs and display names, e.g. water cauldrons being split from cauldrons in 1.17, are not counted here.

== Block and item IDs ==
[[Block]]s and [[item]]s that change their ID in any way also affect their [[statistics]].

== Statistics ==
[[Statistics]] received the following changes:
*Merged the blocks and items tabs.
*Changed to use resource locations.
**
{|class="wikitable collapsible"
|-
!Statistics type!![[Java Edition 1.12|1.12]] syntax!![[Java Edition 1.13|1.13]] syntax!!Remarks
|-
|Everything under the "General" tab||<code>stat.<argument></code>||<code>minecraft.custom:minecraft.<argument></code>||<argument> became lowercased and separated with underscores
|-
|Mined [[block]]s||<code>stat.mineBlock.<argument></code>||<code>minecraft.mined:<namespace>.<block_id></code>||<argument> was before either the numeral ID or namespace.block_id
|-
|Broken [[item]]s||<code>stat.breakItem.<argument></code>||<code>minecraft.broken:<namespace>.<item_id></code>||<argument> was before either the numeral ID or namespace.block_id
|-
|Dropped [[item]]s||<code>stat.drop.<argument></code>||<code>minecraft.dropped:<namespace>.<item_id></code>||<argument> was before either the numeral ID or namespace.block_id
|-
|Used [[item]]s||<code>stat.useItem.<argument></code>||<code>minecraft.used:<namespace>.<item_id></code>||<argument> was before either the numeral ID or namespace.block_id
|-
|Killed [[entities]]||<code>stat.killEntity.<argument></code>||<code>minecraft.killed:<namespace>.<entity_id></code>||<argument> was the pre-1.11 [[entity]] ID
*Now exists for all entities, not just entities with [[spawn egg]]s
|-
|Killed by [[entities]]||<code>stat.entityKilledBy.<argument></code>||<code>minecraft.killed_by:<namespace>.<entity_id></code>||<argument> was the pre-1.11 [[entity]] ID
*Now exists for all entities, not just entities with [[spawn egg]]s
|}

== NBT data ==
[[Chunk format]] was modified.

=== Items ===
Changes to [[Player.dat format#Item structure|item structure]]:
*<code>Damage</code> in the root of the item data removed.
*<code>Damage</code> added in the <code>tag</code> tag, only used for durability.
*<code>map</code> integer added in the <code>tag</code> tag, for [[map]]s.
*<code>Base</code> of [[shield]]s has the colors in the opposite order for consistency.
*<code>ench</code> for [[enchantment]]s got renamed to <code>Enchantments</code>.
*[[Enchantment]] Ids in <code>Enchantments</code> and <code>StoredEnchantments</code> now use the string ids.

=== Entities ===
Changes to [[Chunk format#Entity format|entity format]]:
*<code>CollarColor</code> of [[Wolves]] has the colors in the opposite order for consistency.
*<code>carried</code> and <code>carriedData</code> of [[endermen]] merged into <code>carriedBlockState</code>.<ref group="NBT note" name="tag">This tag will change to a compound format with <code>{Name:"block_id",Properties:{state:"value"}}</code></ref>
*<code>inTile</code> and <code>inData</code> of [[arrow]]s and [[spectral arrow]]s merged into <code>inBlockState</code>.<ref group="NBT note"name="tag"/>
*<code>DisplayTile</code> and <code>DisplayData</code> of [[minecart]]s merged into <code>DisplayState</code>.<ref group="NBT note"name="tag"/>
*<code>Block</code> and <code>Data</code> of [[Tutorial:Falling blocks|falling block]]s merged into <code>BlockState</code>.<ref group="NBT note"name="tag"/>
*<code>ParticleParams1</code> and <code>ParticleParams2</code> from [[area effect cloud]]s removed, merged with Particle (same formatting as in the command).

=== Blocks ===
Changes to [[block entity format]]:
*[[Flower pot]] block entity removed.
*[[Note block]] block entity removed.
*<code>BlockId</code> and <code>BlockData</code> of [[moving piston]]s merged into <code>blockState</code>.<ref group="NBT note"name="tag"/>
*<code>Base</code> from [[banner]]s removed.
*<code>Rot</code> from [[head]]s removed.
*<code>Color</code> of [[banner]]s' and [[shield]]s' <code>Patterns</code> has the colors in the opposite order for consistency.
*<code>Record</code> of [[jukebox]]es removed.

==== Prior specifications ====
;Note block
<div class="treeview">
*{{nbt|compound}} Block entity data
**{{nbt inherit/blockentity}}
**{{nbt|byte|note}}: Pitch (number of {{Control|use|text=uses}}).
**{{nbt|byte|powered}}: 1 or 0 (true/false) - if true, the noteblock is being provided a redstone signal.
</div>

;Flower pot
<div class="treeview">
*{{nbt|compound}} Block entity data
**{{nbt inherit/blockentity}}
**{{nbt|string|Item}}: The Block ID of the plant in the pot. Known valid blocks are ''minecraft:sapling'' (6), ''minecraft:tallgrass'' (31), ''minecraft:deadbush'' (32), ''minecraft:yellow_flower'' (37), ''minecraft:red_flower'' (38), ''minecraft:brown_mushroom'' (39), ''minecraft:red_mushroom'' (40), ''minecraft:cactus'' (81). Other block and item IDs may be used, but not all will render. Together with '''Data''', this determines the item dropped by the pot when destroyed.
**{{nbt|int|Data}}: The data value to use in conjunction with the above Block ID. For example if Item is 6 (a sapling block), the Data is used to indicate the type of sapling.
</div>
{{notelist|NBT note}}

== Commands ==
Some [[command]]s were changed.

*{{cmd|clear}} <code><nowiki>[<data>]</nowiki></code> argument removed.<ref group="command note" name="items">See [[Java Edition 1.13/Flattening#NBT Data|nbt section]] for what happens to other data values. See also 1.13's [[Java Edition 1.13#Commands 2|Items]] section</ref>
*{{cmd|clone}} <code><nowiki>[<data>]</nowiki></code> argument merged with ID and no longer allows metadata.<ref group="command note" name="blocks">See also 1.13's [[Java Edition 1.13#Commands 2|Blocks]] section</ref>
*{{cmd|execute detect}} (now {{cmd|execute if{{!}}unless block}}) <code><nowiki>[<data>]</nowiki></code> argument merged with ID and no longer allows metadata.<ref group="command note"name="blocks"/>
*{{cmd|fill}} <code><nowiki>[<data>]</nowiki></code> and <code>[<replaceData>]</code> arguments merged with ID and no longer allow metadata.<ref group="command note"name="blocks"/>
*{{cmd|give}} <code><nowiki>[<data>]</nowiki></code> argument removed.<ref group="command note"name="items"/>
*{{cmd|replaceitem}} <code><nowiki>[<data>]</nowiki></code> argument removed.<ref group="command note"name="items"/>
*{{cmd|setblock}} <code><nowiki>[<data>]</nowiki></code> argument merged with ID and no longer allows metadata.<ref group="command note"name="blocks"/>
*{{cmd|particle}} <code>[<params>]</code> arguments merged with <code>name</code> and formatted as <code>block_id[states]</code> and <code>item_id</code>.

{{notelist|command note}}

== Advancements ==
Two changes were made to [[advancement]]s:

*<code>icon</code>'s <code>data</code> removed.
*<code>item</code> condition's <code>data</code> removed.

== Loot tables ==
The <code>set_data</code> function was removed from [[loot table]]s.

== Game assets ==
*[[Model]]s
**Renamed to use the new IDs.
*[[Block state]] files
**Renamed to use the new IDs.
**<code>"normal"</code> for blocks without block states changed to an empty string (<code>""</code>).
**Item frames now have <code>"map{{=}}false"</code> instead of <code>"normal"</code> and <code>"map{{=}}true"</code>instead of <code>"map"</code>.
**Model references no longer start at the <code>models/block/</code> folder, but instead at <code>models/</code>.
*Textures
**Renamed to use the new IDs. See [[Java Edition 1.13/Resource pack changes]] for the list of file names changed.
**Renamed the <code>blocks</code> folder to <code>block</code>.
**Renamed the <code>items</code> folder to <code>item</code>.
*[[Recipe]]s
**Renamed to use the new IDs.
*[[Advancement]]s
**Recipe advancements renamed to use the new IDs.
*[[Language]] files
**

||<code>item.yellowDust.name=Glowstone Dust</code>
has been replaced with<br><code>"item.minecraft.glowstone_dust": "Glowstone Dust"</code>

|[[Entities]]||<code>entity.<argument>.name</code>||<code>entity.<namespace>.<entity_id></code>||<argument> was an arbitrary name;

|{{HistoryLine||1.13|dev=17w45a|Command format changed to no longer use metadata and damage values; making the items differing by damage not possible to be given with commands.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=17w47a|The item and block IDs got merged, deleted, separated and renamed.
